intro: Picris turcomanica, commonly known as the Turkestan groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually alternate and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. It is often found in rocky soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
